title: Fat/Deco inspired display face--please identify!
content:
Hi everyone!

I found this on ahem, myspace of all places. I like it allot.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905133944im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/bestfren_4125.jpg)

Anyone know what it is?

 [‹ Font for the movie poster The Other Boleyn Girl](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905133944/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42146 "Go to previous forum topic") [Humanist Serif? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905133944/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42115 "Go to next forum topic")
author: toog

comments.content:
I accidentally double posted, sorry!

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Awesome\>\> [www.biklopsdesign.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905133944/http:/www.biklopsdesign.com/ "www.biklopsdesign.com")
I think that Bifur is a [commercial font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905133944/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=bifur&x=0&y=0&sample_text=BES%20FREN%20SISTERS)

Bifur was created by famous Art Deco designer A. M. Cassandre in 1929 for Deberny & Peignot. Cassandre was the pseudonym of Adolphe Mouron 1901-1968. Several versions have been created besides the P22 Bifur (which has a lowercase), Haroldsfonts has one with several color options.
License the version from P22 it is much much much (did I mention much) better than that at DaFont.
Lowercase rates at least a much much better - not sure about the last much :)
